intro: Billardiera candida, commonly known as the white-flowered mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant native to eastern Australia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, opposite leaves and fragrant white flowers. The plant typically grows on the branches of eucalyptus and other host trees, deriving some of its nutrients through its haustoria. Its fruit is a small, fleshy capsule that contains numerous seeds covered in a sticky substance to aid in seed dispersal. Billardiera candida is often found in moist, shaded environments and plays a role in local ecosystems by providing food for various insects and birds.
